quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: We suffer more in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a living man.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: He who is brave is free.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To be even minded is the greatest virtue.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Circumstances don’t make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: A fit body, a calm mind, a house full of love. These things cannot be bought – they must be earned.
quotes.author: Naval Ravikant

quotes.quote: Don’t explain your philosophy. Embody it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: We should always be asking ourselves: “Is this something that is, or is not, in my control?”
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the very last act of your life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The best answer to anger is silence.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms — you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No man is more unhappy than he who never faces adversity. For he is not permitted to prove himself.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: While we wait for life, life passes.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Whatever can happen at any time can happen today.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Death smiles at us all, but all a man can do is smile back.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well-ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: You are a little soul carrying a corpse.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The only way to escape the slavery of desires is to seek them and remove them.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: You must build up your life action by action, and be content if each one achieves its goal as far as possible—and no one can keep you from this.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
quotes.author: Zen proverb

quotes.quote: How does it help... to make troubles heavier by bemoaning them?
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Self-control is strength. Right thought is mastery. Calmness is power.
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.quote: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Time is like a river made up of events which happen, and its current is strong; no sooner does anything appear than it is swept by and another takes its place, and this too will be swept away.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: To bear trials with a calm mind robs misfortune of its strength and burden.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: When someone is properly grounded in life, they shouldn’t have to look outside themselves for approval.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a living man.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Progress is not achieved by luck or accident, but by working on yourself daily.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: To be even-minded is the greatest virtue.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: A fit body, a calm mind, a house full of love. These things cannot be bought – they must be earned.
quotes.author: Naval Ravikant

quotes.quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: He who is brave is free.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
quotes.author: Zeno of Citium

quotes.quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Do not seek for things to happen the way you want them to; rather, wish that what happens happen the way it happens: then you will be happy.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: A man’s worth is no greater than his ambitions.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Whatever happens at all happens as it should; you will find this true, if you watch narrowly.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.quote: Self-control is strength. Right thought is mastery. Calmness is power.
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.
quotes.author: Seneca
